summary: Revenue from USPS’s most profitable product—First Class Mail—has declined over the last decade. To help stem its significant financial losses and sustain its operations, USPS has been piloting innovative products and services, such as same-day delivery and grocery delivery. However, with ever-shrinking financial resources, USPS needs to make sure that its new and innovative ideas generate revenue and enhance customer experience. We found that the...
title: U.S. Postal Service: Addressing Policy Gaps Could Improve Pilot Design and Evaluation for Postal Innovations
